p: After less than a week of incubation [ 47], MAYV infection causes brutal fever associated with arthromyalgia (sometimes with swollen joints). Headaches, retro-orbital pain, and gastrointestinal symptoms are frequent [ 47, 49, 50, 51, 56, 142, 143, 144, 145]. This acute phase usually lasts two to five days [ 49]. Three independent studies reported benign hemorrhagic signs in a total of seven patients (bleeding gums, epistaxis, petechiae) [ 56, 60, 142]. Only one patient with heavy comorbidities was reported to have died following MAYV infection, without certainty about the cause of death [ 60].
